newsitem.title: UK: Weak investment jeopardizes recovery - UK Labour.
newsitem.headline: Weak investment jeopardizes recovery - UK Labour.

text.p: The low level of investment in manufacturing is jeopardizing the sustainability of the current British economic recovery and threatening a return to the old boom/bust cycle, the opposition Labour Party said on Tuesday.
"Investment, the test of a sustainable recovery, has fallen," shadow finance minister Gordon Brown said.
Brown noted that capital expenditure had fallen by 8 percent.
"It's exactly the problem that bedevilled us through the 1980s. The government cannot claim that this is a sustainable recovery," he said at a Labour party press conference.

"I cannot believe Clarke believes it is right to talk about a boom while investment remains at such a low level," he added, referring to the ruling Conservative Party's finance minister Kenneth Clarke.
Brown is expected to be appointed finance minister if Labour wins the May 1 election.
